newsitem.title: USA: Calif. pension fund continues search for top post.
newsitem.headline: Calif. pension fund continues search for top post.

text.p: The governing board of the California State Teachers' Retirement System (CalSTRS) voted on Thursday to conduct a new search for its chief investment officer position.
The fund said it would use an executive search firm to conduct the new process with the final selection expected in April 1997.
The first search process yielded only one application, from Thomas Flanigan, who is the current chief investment officer (CIO) of CalSTERS, a spokeswoman for the fund said.

"This action is prompted by our desire to promote competition for the CIO position. It has nothing to do with the present incumbent in the position," said Emma Zink, chairperson of the CalSTRS Teachers' Retirement Board.
CalSTRS Chief Executive Officer James Mosman said there was concern on the governing board that several recent searches had produced a limited number of competitors.
"As one of the nation's largest pension funds, we believe the system should be attractive to a wider number of possible competitors," Mosman said.
